Reviews.Title: “Great Central City All Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BongoColo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little older, but well maintained and the rooms are very comfortable small suites, with a refrigerator and microwave. Even though it is a central city hotel, the way the building is positioned on the block made it very quiet, at least in our 10th floor room. Some reviewers have mentioned that they believed it used to be an Embassy Suites, I dont know about that, but it is definitely similar with a large open atrium in the center and glass elevators up and down. The location is a block away from the light rail station, so makes a quick, easy inexpensive trip to the sports venues and other downtown locations. We were here for a diamondbacks series. It has a interior pool with adjoining fitness room. The fitness room is well equipped for this type of hotel, with 3 treadmills and an eliptical, a bicycle, and a weight machine. We only had breakfast at the central atrium patio restaurant, but it was good and reasonably priced. If there is any downside there is not an abundance of other eateries within walking distance. The price we obtained through hotwire was very reasonable for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SaintLouisTraveller
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, somewhat similar to an Embassy Suites (except that breakfast is not included unless you are Hilton Gold or Diamond). I found the room to be large (separate living room and bedroom, with a fairly large bathroom) and experienced no noise problem. Wireless internet costs $9.95/day unless you are Gold or Diamond. My room was close to the point of needing a facelift (wallpaper and carpet getting dated), but the room was clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was also good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cathy E
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! The rooms were the best. Seperate bedroom and living room area. Large desk for working, small fridge, and small microwave. Very quiet and peaceful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Oh yeah, big bathroom with large closet for hanging clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay- Hotel shuttle made it easy to get around”
Reviews.Author: Heather G
Reviews.Content: While this hotel may be located a distance from the convention center area- the shuttle service made it so easy to go back and forth to the convention center multiple times a day. Our favorite shuttle driver was Johnny... He really knew a lot about Phoenix and recommended some great things to do. The hotel itself was very pretty. The glass elevators make the mundane activity of riding an elevator a breathtaking adventure. There were so many pretty plants in the hotel and they were real plants. The koi pond was very calming to look at. Hotel gym was pretty small, but they had passes to a larger gym if you were interested. I didn't go because I was happy with the cardio machines located on-site. The rooms were very comfortable. Having all of that space made the stay very relaxing for two colleagues to share the room while attending the convention. Everyone at the front desk was really helpful and kind. They recommended some great restaurants within the shuttle range too. I would definitely stay here again. This was a great experience and home away from home for the five nights I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but not crazy about the Location”
Reviews.Author: Ravens67
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel off of Hotwire. It was a great price and it said it was downtown. If it was downtown, it must have been on the very edge of downtown. It was just over 2 miles away from US Airways Arena. I was hoping to be within walking distance of downtown activities but could not due to the distance. The hotel does offer a shuttle service that will take you to downtown and pick you up. The driver was really cool. I wish I could remember his name. We talked basketball during the drive to and back from the arena. He also worked at the front desk. The staff at the hotel was really nice. I needed to purchase something out of the gift shop which was closed and the first desk made a quick call and they opened it for me. Room service was fast. I placed a breakfast order late in the morning, and my food was there in less than 20 minutes. I enjoyed the bed and my room was very clean. The parking garage is a little funny. When first parking in the garage, I found the setup a little confusing. They share the garage with a few businesses nearby. All in all, I enjoyed my stay but I was not too crazy about the location. There was a BBQ place within walking distance but that was about it. You need a car, use the shuttle, or catch the Light Rail that's across the street if you want to do anything outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad location.”
Reviews.Author: fleetwoodmamaof4
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious, clean and the beds are comfortable. Beautiful hotel, but located in a less than desirable location. The breakfast buffet was pretty good for 11.95. The small store located in the hotel was hardly ever open, but if you request something at the front desk, they will open it for you.

Reviews.Title: “This tourist would pass”
Reviews.Author: valu8or
Reviews.Content: First time to AZ with short time frame and very limited information about Phoenix so we stayed close to Heard Museum. If we had known about the Light Rail System we would have stayed downtown and taken the LRS to the Heard. Pros: Close to Heard Museum, Pete Roth Thomas amenities, comfy bed and linens, fast coffee maker, friendly staff Cons: Old hotel with tired outdated interior, very weird layout with closet in the bathroom (!), short telephone cord, remotes all needed batteries, not close to anything, gardening crew or some other very noisy service came through at 3 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central location”
Reviews.Author: clippermama
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel. Good central location. Parking is never good and there is always a charge.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: KMHud
Reviews.Content: I travel with some regularity for work and one hotel is much like another to me. As long as it's clean and the staff are efficient, everything is great. I don't really need a suite, but it is nice that the bedroom is situated away from the front door. I've stayed here a couple of times and found there was no hallway noise. The room was clean. On my most recent trip the room I was given smelled like smoke (there was a smoking room two doors down). The staff was able to find me another room with no hassle. Great bed. Lots of pillows. Spacious bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Again, great place to stay for business”
Reviews.Author: jackiepaddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed a second time for business and this is a great place for business. Large suite room with large bathroom. Two flat screens. Nice desk. Sink, fridge and microwave. Good breakfast buffet and comfortable seating areas. Large lobby with plenty of seating. Colleague had a room with a large conference table which worked out well for some meetings we had to hold. Very nice people at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with comfy suites and good breakfast. Lousy locale.”
Reviews.Author: DanLI
Reviews.Content: If you just need a homebase in Phoenix, this hotel will do nicely. Good size and comfortable suites. Excellent breakfast buffet. The light rail is right out front, but you should probably have a car, as there is very little around the hotel, and it's not the nicest area. Oh, and the layout of the parking garage is so strange, that it's worth mentioning here! But there was plenty of free parking for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, very poor security”
Reviews.Author: vfdcapt4
Reviews.Content: Nice room, pleasant staff. We woke up one morning on the 6th floor and a homeless person was sleeping on the floor outside of our room. Told the front desk and after about 10 minutes they went up to make sure that 1. he was still alive and 2. Ask him to leave. When he did leave we were standing outside waiting for the shuttle and he was still allowed to walk around the property for awhile and then urinated on the front door. The staff was nice enough about it but did not really address our security concerns. The hotel is not really near anything to do or places to eat. The light rail is ok and their own shuttle is convenient for rides to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Very attractive hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZTrojan
Reviews.Content: I was overall very pleased with my stay here, but I do wish it was more conveniently located. It's about 2 miles from downtown and they offer a free shuttle service there and back, but unfortunately there is not much to do right around the hotel. It is also very close to the light rail, so that is a plus. The hotel itself is very pretty and I really liked the layout. The pool and bar areas were very nice and the room was very comfortable. I did not drive, so I did not have to pay for parking, but I do know the parking charge is kind of steep. They also charge for internet, but again I did not use that. For lunch or quick dinner, I would highly recommend "Honey Bear's BBQ' that is just to the south of the hotel. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Nice suites in Phoenix Downtown but no nightlife close by!”
Reviews.Author: virobles
Reviews.Content: this hotel is nice! It doesn't have an executive lounge! for hilton gold and diamond memebers! also if you are planing to go out like to a club, you better plan to stayed at Tempe. Other than that its a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “The best choice”
Reviews.Author: Hsintien
Reviews.Content: Nice service and large hotel room. The front desk staff are very polite, they processed my check in and check out fast and

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a sure bet!”
Reviews.Author: Kalandozopap
Reviews.Content: This property is centrally located in Phoenix making most areas in town easily accessible. Your ride to and from the airport should take about 15 minutes. The staff is friendly, the rooms are spacious, well furnished and tastefully decorated. You get a small kitchenette with a refrigerator, so you can store your favorite fruit, chocolate, cheese and beverage. The bar has a relaxed atmosphere and the food is good. Your breakfast is OK, your servers are great. Colleagues and myself both experienced slowness with the internet connections, especially during evening hours. If you are in Phoenix, and the hotel is not booked up, you should try it out. You, like myself, will become a return customer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place in the Downtown”
Reviews.Author: mflan46
Reviews.Content: The lobby is updated and relaxing, the rooms are large and comfortable, and they have access to a nice larger fitness center, in addition to a little one on site. The beds are comfortable and the staff is very friendly. The hotel also has a nice relaxed bar and happy hour snacks for free. All and all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Herb C
Reviews.Content: I've been a Hilton Hhonors Diamond member for 1 year, and I've stayed in close to 20 properties of all levels around the world.. Our room was spacious and the decor was very upscale. The bed had crisp sheets and numerous pillows. The location is great... numerous good restaurants and Target within walking distance. The breakfast was great, and the area seats many people at once. The free breakfast changes every morning and they have eggs, waffles, fresh fruit, coffee, cereal etc- better than a normal Continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “There are nicer places.”
Reviews.Author: susanlbinn
Reviews.Content: This hotel comes off nice at first glance. We were on the Honors floor (11) and had a good size room with balcony. But after you are there for a little while you start to notice the 'ick' issues: the back of the bathroom door has never been cleaned and has something all over it, there is a piece of tile missing from the bathroom baseboard, something was spilled then dripped down the wall next to the bed and it's never been cleaned, shower grout lines are starting to mold. The pool is indoors and the gym is very limited. Walkable to light rail. While do-able In a pinch - if you have time to plan I recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Gem!”
Reviews.Author: TravMuch
Reviews.Content: Lots of familiar touches because it's a Hilton but the rooms are fantastic, large with a conference table and ergo seating for 6-8. On a business trip, it was essential. Also huge was the bathroom with luxurious touches everywhere. But the staff were charming, helpful, pleasant and always willing to go the extra mile to get me what and where I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Night”
Reviews.Author: Emoker
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here way back in May over Mothers Day weekend. I booked online and found a great rate called the Mothers day special, which included a comp arrival ammenity of cupcakes and a rose, a free in-room movie, and brunch in the morning. Even though I wasn't a mom and neither was my friend it was a great package for a one night stay. We enjoyed the room and the breakfast, the hotel was beautiful, however the pool could use some work.Great location to the light rail made is easy to travel downtown to the bars.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect stay near public transportation”
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Clean, quiet, friendly staff, nice furnishings, great climate control. Local shuttle and easy access to light rail. Nice restaurant, lovely lobby. Can't name anything that didn't exceed expectations

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay for business”
Reviews.Author: jackiepaddy
Reviews.Content: HUGE bathroom with two doors, one into bedroom and one into living room. Fridge and sink located in living room. Two large flat screens. Couch, coffee table and desk. Closet is located in bathroom which might be weird if there's more than 1-2 people in the room. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Nice lobby with lots of places to sit. Good breakfast buffet. Within walking distance to many of the financial services and bank buildings. Great free shuttle service within 2-3 mile radius so we had free ride to and from dinner. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A CUT way above!!”
Reviews.Author: SlvrBel
Reviews.Content: Wow! impressive! Did not want to leave...the whole set-up plus the shuttle to and from Chase Field was incredible. I could not believe the price I got for two business suites. The beds were heavenly, I plan on ordering one for my own home.The Peter Thomas Roth personal care amenities..wow again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location on the Metro light rail”
Reviews.Author: Freq_business_travlr
Reviews.Content: This appears to be a hotel popular with mostly business travelers. I arrived on a Thursday, and departed the following Tuesday, and noticed the hotel was mostly deserted over the weekend, but began to fill back up on Monday. Pros: - Conveniently located on the Metro light rail system with easy access to Sky Harbor airport - Clean, quiet rooms and attentive staff - Wet bar with microwave and mini-fridge - Two room suites with separate bedroom and living room with leather couch and side chair. Flat screen TV's in both rooms with nice selection of channels. - Very comfortable beds - On-site restaurant with quality food items, but with a fairly limited menu. Had a delicious steak chef's salad my first night there. The restaurant also offers room service. - Hotel shuttle van available for local trips within a 2-mile radius on a first come first served basis at no charge. Cons: - Daily charge for Wi-Fi Internet access - Daily charge for on-site parking - No complimentary breakfast unless you are a member of the higher levels of the Hilton Honors program. My silver level did not qualify, so the breakfast buffet cost $11.95. - Limited number of other restaurants within walking distance, and when the temp is 108° outside, the distance one wants to walk drops quickly - A bit annoyed that the housekeeping staff started so early on weekend mornings. Had a knock on my door from a housekeeper at 7:30 AM on Sunday morning. But I was already awake and about to leave for work anyway, so no big deal for me. I prefer the Hilton Homewood Suites business model over the Hilton Suites, especially for stays more than a day or two. Homewood includes free Internet access, free parking, along with complimentary breakfasts and light dinners on week days. But if you don't have a rental car, the Hilton Suites may be a better choice with its location on the Metro rail system.

Reviews.Title: “I am so happy with my choice!”
Reviews.Author: Hsintien
Reviews.Content: Excellent, highly recommend. 1. Clean room 2. Good services 3. Reasonable price 4. Convenient location 5. Good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and overall hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dale S
Reviews.Content: I recently spent some time in the Phoenix and Scottsdale area, wanting to see sites and points of interest in both cities. This meant two hotels, which was not a problem. When making the decision on which HiltonHHonors property, the Hilton Suites Phoenix was the choice. The main reason for this property is the close proximity to the Metro Light rail line. The Thomas Rd. station is right by the hotel, and will take you into downtown Phoenix, to Sky Harbor, and to the east terminus point in Mesa (with stops in Tempe). I opted not to rent a car this trip and use light rail. It’s dependable and very affordable ($10.50 for a three-day pass). This is definitely a business-oriented hotel! The entire hotel was not busy including the restaurant and bar. It was very, very quiet which was fine with me! A nice surprise awaited me at check-in! Apparently my name was selected as the “best guest of the day”! This entitled me to a small bottle of wine and a fruit and cheese plate! Nice touch. My room was a standard two-room suite with separate living and bedroom areas. The bathroom was spacious and had the new Peter Thomas Roth amenities. I heard that Hilton had just recently switched to these products, and I found them to be quite nice. The hotel pool is located inside and overlooks the surrounding area, nothing spectacular. I was surprised to find an indoor pool in Phoenix! Adequate fitness center was located in close proximity to the pool, but I did not use it. The hotel is designed much like an Embassy Suites, with the central atrium and rooms all opening out onto it. My thoughts were, was this once an Embassy Suite reflagged a Hilton Suites? The one negative comment I have is the outrageous charge to use a computer in the business center! I travel with my iPhone (and had free Wi-Fi as a Gold) and was able to take care of email and airline check-in. You have the option of swiping a credit card for three minutes of free access and were not inclined to swipe a card for “free” access. I find it very interesting that most Hampton Inn’s, Hilton Garden Inn’s and other HiltonHHonors properties offer free computer access in their business centers, while many Hilton’s do not. As a HiltonHHonors Gold I received coupons for the breakfast buffet. Both mornings the buffet was not available and it was menu service. Luckily my coupons covered the entire cost of my breakfasts. Being a holiday weekend the hotel had very few guests, it probably didn’t pay to have a buffet open. I did not use the complimentary shuttle as the Metro light rail is just a few steps from the hotel (Thomas Road stop along Central Avenue). I would highly recommend this hotel for business stays and for leisure stay also. If you don’t have an automobile the light rail can get you to a host of places such as downtown Phoenix, Tempe, and Mesa. Great property!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Even Greater Service!”
Reviews.Author: waterloo44
Reviews.Content: Recent stay of 3 nights for the Volleyball Festival was a pleasant surprise. Rooms were clean, large, and well-equipped; restaurant meals very good (including an extensive breakfast buffet for V'ball participants at a heavy discount); shuttle to Civic Center & nearby drugstore very convenient; and every staff member we encountered (front desk clerks, restaurant servers, shuttle drivers, and gift shop attendants) was friendly and efficient. Obviously well trained in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “My usual place to stay in Phoenix on business”
Reviews.Author: LAPhil13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to my company's offices in Phoenix and is my preferred hotel there. The rooms have always been clean and comfortable, and the service is good. This last visit the service seemed to have stepped up a bit more - I had great help at the front desk a couple of times. I highly recommend it and am baffled at the negative reviews here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms and Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BC97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Suites for 6 nights split up over two weeks. This is an all suite hotel and the suites are very spacious. The hotel is situated in between two taller office buildings and a large parking garage. So most of the rooms will face these buildings, but the rooms overlooking Thomas have a bit better view beyond immediate buildings. I stayed in rooms 621 and 321 and never heard anyone in surrounding rooms or in the hallway. There is plenty of parking in the adjacent garage. Get a ticket and bring it inside to have it validated/activated, then guests may come and go as they please. The $11/day will be charged to the room. The parking ticket may be swiped to exit the parking lot if the line for the attendant is backed up. The lobby of the hotel is large and inviting and the front desk staff is excellent. The large rooms include a leather sofa with pullout sofabed in the living area. There's a good size desk for one with wired internet (wireless also available). The internet speed isn't great, but enough to get some work done. It's $9.95/day charged to the room. The living area also has a coffee maker, small refrigerator and a sink. There's a flat panel 32" LCD TV and an extra chair with ottoman. The living room and bedroom both have windows to the exterior. The bedroom is nice and comfortable with a GREAT mattress on the bed, two nightstands, dresser (with 32" flat panel LCD on top) and ample lighting. There's a tall mirror as well. The bathroom is large with separate doors to the bedroom and living area. There's a single sink, regular size bathtub with shower and the closet is also in the bathroom. I ordered room service a few times during my 2nd stay and the service was fast and pleasant. The food was surprisingly good. This hotel is a bit more expensive than other hotels in the area, but I feel it's worth it as a business traveler. It's too bad being nickeled and dimed with parking and internet. All in all, this is my hotel of choice when traveling to Phoenix on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Right next to the light rail.”
Reviews.Author: JamisonS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend to watch our Cubs play at Chase Field. The light rail is right across the street and takes you right in front of Chase Field. The room was great. Plenty of space, clean and a comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel lacks service, comfort, and cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: WstrnSkies
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers valet parking and bell service, but when I arrived there was no one to park my car or help with luggage. Is this a full service hotel? My experience was to walk into a room with dirty carpet, a nasty bathroom, and dirty walls. The sleeper soft was horrible and certainly not ergonomic. I will never stay at this hotel nor recommend it to anyone. It needs a top to bottom renovation and until then it is not up to Hilton standards.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure What They Are Trying to Be”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: First, there is no working internet. When you try and get on-line it tells you that the system is overloaded and to try later. It simply does not work. How any hotel expects to serve business travelors with no internet is beyond me. The hotel has little going for it. The rooms are dark, old, popcorn ceilinged, and just worn out. The pool is the size of a large bathtub. The workout room is the size of most kitchens with outdated machines (a grand total of maybe 4 working treadmills is it). The restaurant is as dark as night although they try to make it through a dinner service. This is clearly not a family hotel, it is clearly not a business hotel, and it is clearly not a destination hotel. So what is it. Your guess is as good as mine. Two nights is all they got from me and that is only because I am a Hilton Diamond. Come on Hilton you need to unload this place...quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jimmy0999
Reviews.Content: Location was great - close to the airport. In a run down part of the city - this was the nicest building in the area. We were in Phoenix for a sports weekend. The staff was very friendly and attentive and went out of their way for our group. Liked the open atrium. Also liked the small pool and the buffet breakfast. At a group rate, it was wonderful - don't know if I would have stayed there at their regular prices.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a soon-to-be ex-Hilton?”
Reviews.Author: Tinajas
Reviews.Content: That's the only explanation I can come up with for this un-Hilton-like hotel. It could be a good operation but heaven is in the details in the hospitality trade, and the details here aren't good. From the 50 minutes it took us to get into our room (during a slow time at the front desk) to the deteriorating bathroom door, pretty much everything about this place suggests that the meter is running out. Either that or the manager who has offered so many apologies for previous negative reviews thinks that offering apologies is a good substitute for actually managing the property. The only positive note: we had two good meals served by attentive staff, so whoever runs food service is still trying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, plenty of space, good service, free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: seanop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Suites Phoenix for four days while on business in Phoenix. The organization that I was working for had a corporate rate of $69 per night which is amazing considering that I was in a decent sized hotel suite. My room came equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, wet bar area, desk, and two flat panel tvs, The desk area was in the large living room. There was a separate bedroom with a large king bed, and a nice bathroom that was accessible either through the living room or the bedroom. The service at the hotel is quick an efficient. Upon arrival the bathroom sink didn't drain. They immediately sent a repair man who fixed the problem. The bathroom in general was a little bit dated, but it was clean. They have an amazing service where they will take you in their shuttle anywhere within two miles of the hotel. When you are done, simply call them and they will pick you up. The rail system is also one block over. The internet was a $9.95 charge per day which was irritating. It was extremely slow to the point where you could barely check e-mail. There was an ethernet cable near the desk, but that only provided minimally faster internet. I was staying in the hotel with three other colleagues and all of us had the same issue. We told the people at the front desk and they immediately credited us back our money. I would recommend asking for a refund if the internet is too slow. They are extremely accommodating. The fitness room is a little small, but is equipped with treadmills, ellipticals, and a bike along with some free weights and a universal cable machine. There is also a small pool (not for laps) and a hot tub. Not all of the treadmills work so well. The electronics on at least one of the precor treadmills doesn't register no matter how hard you push the buttons, but at least there is a place to exercise. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Aussieabroad054
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Hilton Suites, while it was close to the airport, it was not close to shops etc so a car would be advisable. Phoenix in general is very spread out. The rooms were large and spacious fitting 4 people in a one bedroom suite. the public areas were clean and the restaurant extremely reasonable. Staff were most helpful in calling taxis etc - the free 2 mile shuttle however proved difficult to contact when he passed on an incorrect number. The main criticism was the extremely soft pillows:(

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean and Central.”
Reviews.Author: Naillic
Reviews.Content: I was passing through Phoenix last week and stayed at the Hilton Suites. I am a Diamond member of HHonors. The hotel is a Hilton Suites hotel which is a brand of Hilron I had never stayed in before. Basically it's exactly the same star rating level as an Embassy Suites hotel. The hotel itself is located about an 15-20minute taxi journey from the airport (about $25). When I arrived it was obvious that the hotel was not busy as all the central areas, lobby etc. were completely empty. I got my room key and after a quick burger at the bar, with a really chatty and friendly Bob, I went to bed for a sound nights sleep. The following morning at breakfast, complimentary to a Diamond member, I met the GM who offered to drive me to Biltmore shopping mall using the hotel minibus. This courtesy was also extended to me later on in the day when I visited the Heard Museum ( a must see thing to do in Phoenix). I found my stay in the hotel to be ultra friendly, very quite and with a good location if you have business downtown. It's not the Ritz but it doesn't claim to be. Everything I came across was fine. I would recommend it to others. However if you are a leisure traveller Scottsdale is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of very loud private parties held in the Atrium!”
Reviews.Author: mamakasa
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine -- we have stayed here before and liked it. Last night, however, there was a very, very loud private party and disco taking place in the Atrium. The front desk staff did try to help and managed to get the music turned down a little, but the noise level still made work/sleep impossible. There is a cut-off of 11 pm for events, we were told, but if (like us) you want a quiet evening and/or an early night, you would be well advised to check if they have any parties booked before making a reservation here. Recheck the day of arrival too, since we were told that they could be last minute bookings for events. It's presumably a business decision on the part of the hotel to allow loud events and deal with complaints from guests after the fact, so those who like quiet hotels should definitely beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Piatravelgal
Reviews.Content: Very comfy and attractive. Staff great. If you aretraveling with your dog, like us, there is s nice park one mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expect (or usually get) from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: sunburntSid
Reviews.Content: Hmmm.... Where to start. Arrived late from Dallas and intended to stay over the wekend as part of 10 day business trip. Checked out after one night. Why - because: Phones didn't work properly; live bird in the Atrium when I had breakfast - not very hygienic; parking a way from hotel and route to hotel badly signed (very subdued lighting around hotel at night); room smelly and despite being non-smoking seemed like someone had smoked in it; smoke alarm in bedroom set off when I had a shower and wouldnt go off; Noisy (despite being on 10th floor in Rm 1020, due to proximity of road; most of the pages missing from the room service menu. On the plus side, the staff were friendly and helpful. This place needs some TLC and management guidance... And how many US hotels make you pay for parking!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not even good...”
Reviews.Author: FairfieldCounty83
Reviews.Content: The place isn't awful, it's just not good. First, the whole lobby smells like a pool due to the water features that are in the 15 story lobby that all the rooms surround. The rooms are nothing better than rooms at a courtyard marriott. The internet is an additional charge, and SLOW as Dial Up! Parking is an additional charge! ...You're 5+ miles from downtown Phoenix, and you Charge for Parking?!?! Lastly, BOTH the shower and the sink were INSANELY slow to drain, very gross! I would not stay here again, and I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone! Despite it's convenience to businesses in the area, stay some place else!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: geno87
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was close to the light rail, making it easy to get to the hotel from the airport. I was really surprised when I got my room as it was an actual suite, which I hadn't expected. I went down to the hotel bar on my first night as I didn't want to dine alone and I thought it would be good to chat to someone. Jamie at the bar was lovely and super friendly and I was able to order a restaurant meal at the bar. Carly the manager and the reception staff were really helpful when I was trying to sort out Grand Canyon tours or when I needed a cab called.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Finaffrey
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Every time we need to stay near downtown Phoenix, this is the property we choose. The rooms are spacious. The beds are so comfortable and the black out curtains so effective that my husband and I slept later than we have in years - heaven! When I left a brand new bottle of facial wash in the shower after we left, the hotel located it and sent it to my house via UPS at no charge. I had the item one day after checking out. That's what I call service. Not fond of the indoor swimming pool, but I like the modern feel of the hotel and the fact that it's within easy walking distance of Phoenix's metro line. The koi ponds and water features in the lobby are a nice touch, and seating for breakfast is located around these ponds. Bartenders and front desk staff are incredibly friendly, and you can't beat the free shuttle to U.S. Airways Center if you're in town for a concert or game.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: BorisSWort
Reviews.Content: Okay hotel. Nothing that great, nothing that bad. Never could get room cool enough to sleep well, but then again it was Phoenix in June.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations- Best Hilton I've stayed at in ages”
Reviews.Author: RenardFX
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hilton Suites was a very pleasant surprise. Normally, I've found Hilton hotels to be underwhelming and overpriced but my stay here was different. The desk at check-in was friendly and pleasant, and helpful throughout my stay. The entire hotel is situated around a large, covered atrium which made it feel larger than it actually was. The rooms were impressive. There was a combined small kitchen area and living room, and a sizeable bedroom. The living room and bedroom had two regular size flat screen TVs. The bathroom was a little small but only slightly. The breakfast buffet in the atrium in the morning was fine, although unremarkable. Overall, it far exceeded what I expected and although it was slightly more expensive than a normal Hilton, it was well worth it. Frankly, better than many pricier hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Neat room, good service, I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: CastaLusoria
Reviews.Content: A colleague picked the Hilton Suites Phoenix for our stay to run a class at a nearby location. Check-in was smooth and easy; some Hilton locations offer free WiFi for frequent-traveler-program members; this one doesn't. My room was spacious, quiet (never heard a peep from neighbors, and I know a lot of rooms were booked that week), and had all the amenities I needed. Room service was swift and friendly, and checkout was smooth and easy. It was a very convenient visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fine facility if you have to stay downtown, but weak on service”
Reviews.Author: mrsirin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for several nights. We had to change dinner plans one night on very short notice, and the very young desk staff (early 20s) couldn't recommend a single "fine dining" restaurant. Also, a call to housekeeping regarding a lost item reached voicemail, and my message wasn't returned. I was also surprised that the hotel charges $10 a day for wireless access. The facility was fine, but we learned that staying in downtown Phoenix is not a good idea, since there's no central area in which to walk around, and the whole town shuts down around 9 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: yuriyguzman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located directly across from a light rail stop, which we took straight from Sky Harbor Airport, saving a lot of $ on taxi fares. Hotel staff was extremely courteous and receptive. Check-in was a breeze, and we got to our rooms before the hotel mandated check in times with no problem. Rooms were clean, with nice amenities and everything was great in the rooms. Hotel staff was great during our entire 4 day trip. Only complaint I have is that the pool is a bit small and awkwardly located, but other than that I would easily recommend this to anyone travelling on business or on a short leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Event”
Reviews.Author: JonesSkeltonHochuli
Reviews.Content: We had our firm's holiday party with the Hilton and it was fabulous! The setting was beautifully decorated for the holidays and the staff was on-point and well organized before and during the event. We will definitely use them for events throughout the year and no question where we will have our holiday party!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL IN PHX”
Reviews.Author: MONK09
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, food, gym, swimming pool helpful staff free shuttle services very good location reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, nice suites, conveniently near light rail”
Reviews.Author: hardtosay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Suites Phoenix for one night in late October, while attending an event at the US Airways Center. I was overall quite pleased by my stay. Our room was on the third floor, not far from the elevator, and was a nice big suite consisting of a front room with large desk, sofa, armchair, and large LCD TV, a back room with two double beds and another large LCD TV, and a large bathroom that had doors onto both rooms. The beds were comfortable, and the blackout curtains did a really good job shutting out the bright Phoenix sun if we wanted to nap - or sleep in in the morning. The bathroom had a good size counter, more than enough room to spread out. The one closet in the room was in the bathroom, for some reason (including an ironing board and iron, a robe, extra blankets). The towels were good, and there was a convenient makeup mirror attached to the wall. The one thing that seemed to be missing was a hairdryer. The front room was nice to have as a great place to hang out, and for me to work on my laptop after my friend went to sleep without bothering her. There was also a small minibar area with a fridge and sink (and possibly a microwave, but I don't recall). I spent quite a lot of time in the room and one thing I noticed was that it was very quiet - the sound insulation is great. I stayed at a different hotel before where there was an open atrium area and it was LOUD - everything echoed up through the atrium into the rooms - but in this hotel, it wasn't a problem. The lobby/atrium area is this huge open area, with all the floors looking down on it, which is quite lovely, and has the Great American Grill restaurant and the Atrium Lounge located in it. The pool is in a separate room, with glass overlooking the atrium, and the small gym is located off the pool (I think you have to walk through the pool room to get to the gym). I didn't use the pool or hot tub or the gym, but I took a look around. The gym had what looked like pretty new equipment - a couple treadmills, an elliptical machine - all with their own TV screens attached, possibly a bike, some medicine balls, and one of those all-in-one weight/resistance machines. I got breakfast at the Great American Grill - it was like $12 for an open buffet type breakfast that was pretty decent, though the pancakes and french toast sticks got hard as rocks really quickly. There were plenty of other options, though - oatmeal with stuff to put in it, cereal, with 3 different kinds of milk to choose from and cut up fruit you could put on top, toast, bagels, eggs, sausages (2? kinds), bacon, potatoes, and other cookied veggies and warm options. The Hilton Suites is conveniently located very close to the Central/Thomas light rail stop, which is about a 20-30 minute ride away from the Phoenix airport (you take a shuttle from the terminal to the 44th and Washington stop), and only costs $1.75 one-way ($3.50 for an all-day pass). The light rail runs down Washington, through downtown Phoenix (right past the US Airways Center at I think the 3rd St/Jefferson or 3rd St/Washington stop), and then turns at Central, and goes up Central past the Heard Museum and the Phoenix Art Museum, to the hotel and beyond. There is parking at the hotel in the garage next door which I *think* you're supposed to pay for based on some material in the room, but which somehow we didn't get billed for. There's a small strip mall right across the street from the hotel with a Subway, Domino's Pizza, sushi place, and burger place, and then diagonally across the street there's a BBQ place and some other restaurant. A little further down Central was a Burger King, IHOP, and some other restaurants. The service was quite good - I was able to get a late checkout time of 2pm quite easily, which was nice. There was a kiosk in the lobby where you can check in to your flight and print out boarding passes. Service was a little slow at breakfast since it was a buffet/seat yourself type thing - you just need to be a bit proactive about catching the waiter's eye. I didn't like that you had to pay for internet - I think free wifi should be standard. The hotel is also a little far from the US Airways Center (though the light rail makes it easier, the last light rail runs at 11pm, which is a bit limiting for events that run late). Overall, I would recommend the Hilton Suites when staying in Phoenix, especially due to its proximity to the light rail, and its nice, comfortable, quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: leftee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just over a week with ten high school age girls participating in the Volleyball Festival. Not sure we could have chosen better. From the moment we checked in the staff bent over backwards to accommodate us. They gave excellent recommendations for dining out with the girls, suggested various shopping venues (essential), shuttled us to and from local restaurants and the Convention Center, provided good breakfasts for the kids, and always had a cheerful word for us. The hotel is located very near to a Light Rail stop, central to most of Phoenix and relatively close to the airport. We'll be back. Thanks to everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: I took the light rail to the hotel all the way from the airport. The hotel is located right across the street from a station. The staff is extremely friendly. I enjoyed the company of the bar staff in the lounge (Brian and Bob), the front desk, and the morning breakfast staff were all courteous. The hotel has a large atrium in the middle where all the rooms go around the outside. I was on the 9th floor and being scared of heights it was tough for me to walk too close the the railing. I literally hugged the wall. The room had a separate bedroom and living room with a desk. The bathroom was very large and clean. Breakfast buffet was $12 and you have to pay for parking and for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Some of the BEST service i have ever seen ... EVER”
Reviews.Author: GabeFranchise
Reviews.Content: Staying here to see a few D-Backs games and hang out with my dad for the weekend, couldnt have stayed at a better place. Check in, got an upgrade to a 2 room suite, super nice. Chris who drove the shuttle, he is a stud. Took good care of us, as did all of the staff at this hotel. Working at a 4 star hotel myself, this is the kind of service i would expect at my own hotel. Thank you Hilton for having an amazing staff and a great property to back them up!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet hotel with accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMom04
Reviews.Content: Spacious and comfortable suites. Complementary shuttle service that was always prompt and allowed us to save significantly on transportation costs. Front desk was always friendly and quite helpful. Ate dinner at the bar one evening. While the bartenders are jovial and entertaining, the food definitely receives a thumbs down. It might have been what I ordered, but it was over-priced and tasted horribly. It was the one and only negative about my entire stay. I definitely though would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grest for Business”
Reviews.Author: JMoCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and book many hotels for events and lodging. I was a little concerned about booking a training event and hotel stay for 9 people at the Hilton Suites after reading some reviews. However I have no complaints and would recommend it for a leisure or business stay and for event/catering purposes. The staff was outstanding and the value for lodging and the facilities was hard to beat. The nice sized suites are a pleasant surprise and and very handy for the business traveler. The rooms have all been re-done and through there are some (minor) rough spots- they were easily outwieghed by the size of the rooms and the facility. Not one of the 9 people that stayed at the hotel had a bad thing to say- and that's tough. I did not eat there however so I can't attest to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference & Event Staff”
Reviews.Author: driverPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I work nearbye and often book the Hilton for larger conferences and events. The hotel staff is friendly and they go above and beyond to make sure each meeting is a complete success. The hotel is convenient and the location is perfect. I'll surely book the Hilton for my next meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Chart!”
Reviews.Author: barefootcontessa56
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable! I booked this hotel for a 4 day training session for about 25 attendees. Every, single person in my group went out of their way to tell me how accomodating and wonderful the staff was. They anticipated our every need, acted with a sense of urgency and treated us like we were the only group in the hotel. Our 2 room suites were all very nice and well-laid out, spacious and with every ammenity. I feel I need to give accolades to the staff there. Ardith, the Sales Manager and her staff; Heather, Lynn and Jon; as well as the front desk staff made this our home-away-from-home for the length of our stay. They are all now considered part of my extended family. This will be my company's ONLY Phoenix meeting spot from now on! Thank you all!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok but would not return”
Reviews.Author: runner27
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK with some good qualities like the free shuttle with a 2 mile radius and the comfortable beds. On the negative side, the front desk staff didn't seem too responsive. I had trouble with in-room internet access and they weren't too energetic about helping me. The hotel shop wasn't open. No room service until 5PM. The drink menu on the website is not the same as the bar. The bar tender said they don't do "fancy drinks." The service at the bar was also indifferent. The room was noisy. Anyway, I am not a picky guy but expected more and better from this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. Overall, it's got a great ambiance. The rooms are huge with very nice beds. We saw no bedbugs at all, nor did we have any bedbug bites at all. The bathroom is also quite nice. The central lobby is an atrium with a restaurant downstairs. The gym is small but functional. The pool is indoors. Unfortunately, there is no safe in the room. The location is central phoenix, so it is near most things downtown. Keep in mind, you need a car to get around phoenix, and you really cannot walk around to see stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: email_this_page
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week. Whatever nice things I may have had to say about this place were quickly forgotten as I awoke on the last night of my stay with large red welts all over my feet. This place has bed bugs, and when I informed the front desk, the attendant didn't even write down my room number or seem all that interested in following up on the problem. He certainly didn't offer any sympathy. Based on research I have done since my return, it appears that I"m not the first person to have problems with bed bugs at this hotel - I would stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms & great location”
Reviews.Author: Flippitti
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel - July 23, 2009. This wasn't our first stay (see our previous review for our Mar 2007 stay). We were attending an Eddie Izzard performance at the Orpheum Theatre and the Hilton Suites is about 2 miles from there. The check-in staff was friendly and informative. They offer shuttle service within 2 miles of the hotel but it stops at 10PM so we couldn't take advantage of it to go to the Orpheum. Parking is $11 a day. They share a parking garage with the plaza next door but the garage is very close and accessible. We preferred parking there because it was under cover and we didn't want to leave our car in the 108 degree heat. Our room was on the 11th floor. This is an all-suites hotel so each room has a separate bedroom, living room and a pass-through bathroom. There's also a desk with internet connections. We also had a wet-bar with coffeemaker and single-packet ground coffee, tea and sugar/cream packs. We had a small microwave and fridge. There wasn't a mini-bar in this room. Our room also had flat-screen TVs in both the bedroom and living room. Our king-size bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in! The sheets were clean and crisp and the bed was just the right firmness. Generally, this was one of the cleanest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in as well. The hotel restaurant is located in the center atrium. We had dinner there. Overall, they had a good selection and our pasta dishes were tasty but our garden salads look like they had been sitting inside the fridge way too long. At check-in we were also given vouchers for free breakfast buffet. That was okay. The selection was small - the hot selections included scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage, french toast, pancakes and oatmeal. There was also made-to-order omelets and cereal and pastries. Very little fruit was offered though. If you aren't given free breakfast vouchers, the cost would be around $12.00 per person. The location of this hotel is near several large corporate buildings so there are quite a lot of business people staying here. During our stay, we didn't see any large groups of of kids or young people and we didn't experience any loud or boisterous parties. We would definitely stay here again if we are ever in Phoenix to attend a nearby performance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ksmith2263
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the hotel. The room was very spacious, clean and quiet. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant, and it was also very good. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone without any reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but overloaded with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Amarquez2021
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the last month. Two times were for work the last time was for fun. The hotel in itself is nice and the rooms are great. Room service is good but they do not offer alot of choices. The first week there were several schools that had booked rooms for sport teams. These were high school aged kids and they were LOUD! I was not able to work in my room and it didnt calm down until way after midnight. The second week was fine. No teenagers or sport teams and everything was wonderful. The third visit we were back and groups and I mean groups of school cheerleaders were running around. The pool showed closing hours of 10 pm however kids were still screaming and swimming at midnight. Overall the hotel is nice but most of the time is over ran with teenagers and it appears hotel staff does nothing to calm or quite the sittuation. If you dont mind the noise then it is a great hotel to stay at otherwise there are other nice hotels in the area.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Suites Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 10 East Thomas Road, Phoenix, AZ 85012-3114
